trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Selecting"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource"></xref> control.

By adding an event handler delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Selecting> event, you can perform any additional preprocessing required or cancel the database query entirely.

Because the SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs class is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceCommandEventArgs> class, you can cancel a pending <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> database query by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.

You can examine and manipulate the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbCommand.CommandText%2A>, <xref:System.Data.Common.DbCommand.Parameters%2A> collection, and other database query properties prior to running the query by accessing the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbCommand> object exposed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceCommandEventArgs.Command%2A> property.

You can also examine the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object that is passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> method by accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs.Arguments%2A> property.

The SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs class is used in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.OnSelecting%2A> method to provide access to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> database query before it is run.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control exposes many events that you can handle to work with the underlying data objects during the course of a data operation.
The following table lists the events and associated <xref:System.EventArgs> classes and event handler delegates.
|Event|EventArgs|EventHandler| |-----------|---------------|------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Selecting>.

Occurs before the data is retrieved.|SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceSelectingEventHandler>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Inserting>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Updating>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Deleting>.

Occur before an insert, update, or delete operation is performed.|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceCommandEventArgs>|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceCommandEventHandler>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Selected>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Inserted>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Updated>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Deleted>.

Occur after the data retrieval, insert, update, or delete operation completes.|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceStatusEventArgs>|<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceStatusEventHandler>|

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs"></xref> class, using the specified <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbCommand"></xref> object and any <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select*> method.
The `inputParameters` parameter is an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> collection of name/value pairs that match those in the method signature and are passed by reference.
An <xref href="System.Data.Common.DbCommand"></xref> object that represents the cancelable <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select*> query.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select*> method.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select*> method.
You can examine the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object to determine whether sorting, paging, or a row count are requested as part of the data retrieval operation.

Data-bound controls use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> class to request that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> perform additional data-related operations on a result set, such as sorting the data or returning a specific subset of data.
These data-related operations are enumerated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities> enumeration.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments>.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if no <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object is specified during <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceSelectingEventArgs"></xref> creation.
